content:
Diagnosis:	Prostate cancer - lymphoepithelioma-like carcinoma
	Stage T2cN1M0 with pelvic nodal involvement
	PSA 23.4, EBV positive

Management:	15 Mar 2024 Commenced on PROSTATIC trial protocol
	Randomised to Arm B: Durvalumab + ADT

Current situation:	Baseline assessments completed

[redacted name] attended clinic today for trial registration and baseline assessments. His prostate cancer was diagnosed in January 2024 following elevated PSA, with subsequent biopsy confirming lymphoepithelioma-like carcinoma. MRI and staging CT showed bilateral prostate disease with right external iliac nodal involvement. Given the rare histological subtype and EBV positivity, he was considered for the PROSTATIC trial.

He has completed all screening investigations including cardiac echo (normal), baseline CT (stable from staging), and required blood tests. Trial eligibility has been confirmed. The protocol requirements, potential side effects, and follow-up schedule have been discussed in detail. He understands the randomisation outcome to Arm B with durvalumab immunotherapy alongside ADT.

He will commence treatment next week following completion of trial-mandated 7-day safety window. ADT will be initiated today. We will see him weekly for the first month as per protocol requirements, then transition to 3-weekly reviews. The first trial-mandated CT assessment will be at 12 weeks.
